Benjamin Carlyle wrote:
> I see this suggestion as a practical breakdown of the system. No node in
> the system can sustainably claim equivalence of two urls except as
> defined by scheme without adding "for my purposes".

Sure it can.

Just like I can say that the identifiers "Norma Jean Mortenson" and 
"Marilyn Monroe" identify the same person.

Of course I can also say that "Marilyn Monroe" and "Marilyn Manson" 
identify the same person. The fact that a claim that two URIs identify 
the same resource can be wrong is a different matter to whether they 
actually can do so.
